Overview.Summary: The 2023 Luxembourg general election is scheduled for October 8, 2023 (2,3). The election will determine the result of the election, with voters electing 60 members to the Chambre des Députés (2). The Election Commission of Pakistan will oversee the election (4), while Spain will also hold a general election in June of 2023 (7). The election will be conducted according to the constitution and guarded against corrupt practices (4). In the United States, Hawaii and Minnesota will also hold general elections in 2022 (9,10).

Timeline.Text: The 2023 Luxembourg general election takes place, with the ruling party securing a majority and extending their rule to a third decade.
The results of the 2023 Luxembourg general election are certified and confirmed.
The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) announces the schedule for the 2024 general elections.
As of June 2023, a close race is predicted between two parties in the upcoming General Elections of Spain.
The 2022 Pennsylvania election results are released, with the Republican party securing a majority.
The results of the 2022 Hawaii general election are officially certified.
Live election results for the 2022 Minnesota attorney general race are reported.

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Luxembourg general election will take place on October 8 (1). Postal voting applications opened on July 17, 2023 (1). The Luxembourg government has proposed changes to the tax code and budget in preparation for the election (2, 5, 9). The election is also significant as it will be the first time a woman-led couple has been the most elected in any Luxembourg election in recent memory (7). There are also discussions about increasing the price of cigarettes in the country (10).

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Luxembourg general election will take place on October 8, 2023 (1, 14, 15). It is a significant election for the country as it will determine the members of the 60-seat Chamber (1, 14). The election will also be a "super year" as it will coincide with other important elections in the country (1). Postal voting applications opened on July 17, 2023 (2) and residents of Luxembourg have until September 13 to register (2). The election comes amid global economic uncertainties and the government has proposed tax changes and modernization measures in its 2023 budget bill (4, 7, 11). The election will also see the abolition of the 5-year residence clause for non-Luxembourg citizens (15). The election will be monitored by the Autorité de la concurrence (17) and will be held alongside the election of six judges for the International Criminal Court (20).
